Package pkgController

Class SelectPlantsController

java.lang.Object
pkgController.SelectPlantsController
public class SelectPlantsController
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Zane Greenholt Controller that holds the handlers for the select plants screen

  • Constructor Details

    • SelectPlantsController

      public SelectPlantsController​(View view, SelectPlantsView spv, SelectCarouselController scc)
      Constructor simply initializes fields with the corresponding arguments
      Parameters:
      view - The program's View that is only initialized once
      spv - SelectPlantsView that holds all the Nodes for the select plants screen
      scc - SelectCarouselController that holds handlers for the select plants screen's carousel

  • Method Details

    • clickedBack

      public void clickedBack​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handler for clicking back to the previous screen. It takes the user to the drawGarden screen.
      Parameters:
      event - An ActionEvent that is a mouse click

    • clickNext

      public void clickNext​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handler for clicking to the next screen. It takes the user to the editGarden screen after serializing the plants that were selected so they can be correctly added to the garden.
      Parameters:
      event - an ActionEvent that is a mouse click

    • plantSelected

      public void plantSelected​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handler for when a plant in the carousel is clicked. It removes the plant from the carousel and adds it to the lists of selectedPlants/images in the corresponding model and view
      Parameters:
      event - A MouseEvent that is the mouse being clicked

    • getHandlerForPlantSelected

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getHandlerForPlantSelected()
      Getter for the plantSelected handler
      Returns:
      EventHandler for the plantSelected method

    • plantDeselected

      public void plantDeselected​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handler for when an image is clicked in the selected plants flowPane. When the image is clicked it is removed from selected plants lists and added back to the carousel
      Parameters:
      event - A MouseEvent that is the mouse being clicked

    • checkPlantConditions

      public boolean checkPlantConditions​(PlantInfoModel plant, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String soil, java.lang.String sun, java.lang.String moisture, java.util.List<java.lang.String> soils)
      Helper method that checks if a plant matches current user selected conditions on the selectPlants screen
      Parameters:
      plant - The plantModel that is currently being considered
      type - The plant type chosen by the user
      soil - A specific soil type chosen by the user
      sun - The sun level chosen by the user
      moisture - The moisture level chosen by the user
      soils - A list of all soils that were placed on the drawGarden screen
      Returns:
      boolean representing whether or not the plant fits the current conditions

    • selectedPlantPopup

      public void selectedPlantPopup​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handler for infoPopups when plant VBoxes are clicked in the selectedPlants listView
      Parameters:
      event - A MouseEvent representing a click

    • getHandlerForSelectedPlantPopup

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getHandlerForSelectedPlantPopup()
      Getter for the selectedPlantPopup handler
      Returns:
      An EventHandler for selectedPlantPopup

    • getHandlerForPlantDeSelected

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getHandlerForPlantDeSelected()
      Getter for the plantDeselected handler
      Returns:
      EventHandler for the plantDeselected method

    • getHandlerForBack

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getHandlerForBack()
      Getter for the clickedBack handler
      Returns:
      EventHandler for the clickedBack method

    • getHandlerForNext

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getHandlerForNext()
      Getter for the clickedNext handler
      Returns:
      EventHandler for the clickedNext method
